list_page_teaser: Obi-Wan Kenobi and Yoda have similar personalities - and their spiritual portraits are similar as well.  Click to learn more!
description_html: Keep it objective: no first or second person.
story_html:
Make it personal (first and second person ok), preferably with a beginning, middle, and end.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: Yoda
image_list.subtitle_html: Grand Master of the Jedi Order
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Yoda's spiritual portrait shows he is, like Obi-Wan Kenobi, idealistic and logical.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Yoda's dominant personality trait, his strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than facts.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  Yoda demonstrates this trait when he performs psychokinesis, using his powers of concentration to get The Force to move objects.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Yoda's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  Yoda demonstrates this trait in
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Obi-Wan Kenobi
image_list.subtitle_html: Jedi Master and Mentor of Luke Skywalker
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Obi-Wan Kenobi's spiritual portrait shows he is, like Yoda, idealistic and logical.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Obi-Wan Kenobi's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  Obi-Wan demonstrates this trait in
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Obi-Wan Kenobi's auxiliary personality trait, his preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than facts.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  Obi-Wan demonstrates this trait when he performs psychokinesis, using his powers of concentration to get The Force to move objects.
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.
